title: Cat. 82.1  Tahitian Idol—the Goddess Hina, 1894/95
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Tahitian Idol—the Goddess Hina  
1894/95  
Wood-block print in black ink, over brush and solvent thinned and selectively applied yellow ocher, reddish-orange and touches of green and pink wax-and-resin-based media (est.), on cream wove paper, 148 × 119 mm (image/sheet)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of Edward McCormick Blair, 2002.245  
Guérin 44, Kornfeld 32  
For the verso, see fig. 82.1.1

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">Sold at Christie's, New York, to Alice Adam Ltd., Chicago, for Edward McCormick Blair (1915–2010), Chicago, May 11, 1982, lot 279.

Given by Edward McCormick Blair to the Art Institute of Chicago, 2002.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Bar Harbor, Maine, Ethel H. Blum Gallery, College of the Atlantic, From Paradise to Eden: Gauguin in Tahiti, Aug. 10–Sept. 11, 1999, cat. 19.

Art Institute of Chicago, Intimate Encounters: Paul Gauguin and the South Pacific; The Edward McCormick Blair Collection, Sept. 6, 2003–Jan. 11, 2004, cat. 23.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine H. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), p. 146, cat. 32.

Douglas Druick and Peter Zegers, From Paradise to Eden: Gauguin in Tahiti, exh. cat. (College of the Atlantic, Ethel H. Blum Gallery, 1999), p. 10, cat. 19.

Art Institute of Chicago, Intimate Encounters: Paul Gauguin and the South Pacific; The Edward McCormick Blair Collection, exhibition brochure (Art Institute of Chicago, 2003), cat. 23.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section other_documentation" id="other_documentation">Signed in wood block, lower left, printed in white-line manner: P G O

Inscribed lower right, in graphite: Le petit Idole

Inscribed lower left, in graphite: cat n. ‑

</section><section epub:type="footnotes" id="footnotes">Alice Adam Ltd., Chicago, invoice, May 13, 1982, to Edward Blair, Sr. Sold at Christie’s, New York, Old Master and Modern Prints, sale cat. (Christie’s, New York, May 11, 1982), lot 279 (ill.).

</section><section id="figures">Cat. 82.1 Tahitian Idol—the Goddess Hina, 1894/95.

fig. 82.1.1 Verso of Gauguin’s Tahitian Idol—the Goddess Hina (1894/95). The Art Institute of Chicago, 2002.245.

</section>
